Name.BusinessNameLine1: Arts Council of Greater Baton Rouge Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES AND CULTURAL DEVELOPMENT FOR THE COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Arts Council of Greater Baton Rouge is a catalyst for the arts providing arts education, jobs, programs, and events in and around Baton Rouge. We are working to create a better place to live.
IRS990.Description: ESTABLISHMENT AND PROMOTION OF AREA ARTS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING "CREATE BATON ROUGE", AND DECENTRALIZED ARTS FUNDING.

Activity2.Description: CAMPAIGN DRIVE - ANNUAL FUND DRIVE FOR PARTICIPATING AGENCIES IN THE GREATER BATON ROUGE AREA. GRANTS ISSUED TO SYMPHONY, THEATRES, GALLERIES, ETC.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The organization's Community Development Coordinator (CDC) oversees a peer review panel system, appeals process, appropriate financial audits and reporting documents. The CDC provides a funding spreadsheet to the Financial Director, which lists the awards recommended by the peer review panel and approved by the Board of Directors. CDC submits a final report to the State of Louisiana, Office of Cultural Development, and Division of the Arts (DOA).

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 review committee, which is made up of the finance committee, reviewed Form 990 and suggested approval to the board of directors. The review committe reports its findings and recommendations, if any, to the Board of Directors. The board subsequently approved the filing of Form 990 prior to its submission to the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The board of directors must sign a conflict of interest policy statement annually and disclose any issues, which could give rise to conflicts of interest.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board reviews the compensation of the CEO and other staff for appropriateness based on the financial and operational health of the organization, market conditions for comparable personal service, and other factors that the Directors consider applicable.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes these documents available upon request.
